title: Chopper Inspired Gear 2 Theory
theory: Luffy must have gotten the idea for Gear 2 from Chopper, as Chopper is the only crew member who could have provided the medical knowledge necessary to understand manipulating blood flow. This theory suggests Luffy consulted with Chopper about how to make his body stronger.
author: Fan community discussion

title: CP9 Observation and Adaptation Theory
theory: Gear 2 is a product of Luffy's observational skills. The theory suggests that Luffy watched CP9 use their Rokushiki techniques, particularly Soru (Shave), and then applied what he observed to his own abilities. Luffy's learning style involves copying techniques from opponents and adapting them to work with his Devil Fruit powers.
author: Fan community discussion

title: Steam Engine Inspiration Theory
theory: In Chapter 388, Blueno asks Luffy if he is trying to imitate a steam engine when he sees Gear 2. Some fans theorize that Luffy may have been inspired by steam engines he encountered during his travels, using the concept of pressure and heat to enhance his body's performance.
author: Fan community discussion

title: Water 7 Building Compression Theory
theory: This theory proposes that Luffy discovered Gear 2 when his body was compressed between buildings for extended periods during the Water 7 arc. The compression may have accidentally activated the blood-pumping mechanism that would become Gear 2.
author: Fan community discussion

title: Aokiji Defeat as Catalyst Theory
theory: Following Luffy's devastating defeat by Admiral Aokiji, he realized he needed to become exponentially stronger to protect his crew from future threats of similar caliber. This theory, supported by canon dialogue, suggests Luffy specifically trained and developed Gear 2 as a response to understanding the gap between his current power and the strength needed to protect his friends in the New World.
author: Canon-supported fan analysis

title: Gear 2 vs Gear 5 Impact Theory
theory: Despite Gear 5 being Luffy's ultimate form, many fans theorize that Gear 2 remains the most impactful and well-executed power-up in the series. The theory argues that Gear 2's introduction was perfectly paced, narratively earned through Luffy's defeat by Aokiji, and delivered without excessive fanfare. This makes it feel more organic and satisfying than later power-ups.
author: Screen Rant and fan community
